message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the behaviors and habitats of bipeds (organisms with two legs) that use tools. Option (D) is the correct answer because if a biped that uses tools is in an ideal habitat, it would likely have created or adapted its environment to include rooms or sheltered spaces for various purposes, such as living, sleeping, or storing tools. Options (A), (B), and (C) are unrelated to the behavior of bipeds using tools and are not commonly found in their ideal habitats.

In an ideal habitat for humans, there will typically be rooms or dwellings of some kind. Option (A) is incorrect because sharks are not typically found in habitats suitable for humans. Option (B) is incorrect because glaciers are not part of a typical human habitat. Option (C) is unrelated to the concept of an ideal habitat for bipeds.
